fields.headline: World in brief
fields.bodyText: Dozens hurt in Spanish running of the bulls fiesta A traditional running of the bulls festival in Spain degenerated into a stampede yesterday leaving 37 people hurt, 10 seriously. Around 2,000 people took part in the Virgin of Butarque fiesta at Leganés, south of Madrid. Panic developed in the five-minute run as four bulls caught up with revellers, goring three. Seven of the other victims suffered head, rib and leg injuries and were taken to hospital while the remainder suffered cuts and bruising. US apologises over deaths US Secretary of State Colin Powell, right, phoned Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf to express 'regret' at the killing of two Pakistani soldiers by US troops on the Afghan- Pakistan border last week, Pakistan's foreign ministry said. Fire closes Iraqi pipeline Pipeline faults and a fire stopped all oil flow from Iraq to Turkey yesterday just three days after the pipeline between the two countries was reopened, US military said. Soldiers were helping Iraqi oil workers contain the fire that had been burning since Friday outside the northern town of Baiji on a section of the 600-mile pipeline from Kirkuk to the Turkish city of Ceyhan. 'There is no oil flowing into Turkey right now,' said US chief engineer Colonel Bobby Nicholson.
